abstracts.cdata!:
Construction of the Kyrgyz Urban
            Transport Project will involve repair, and installation of
            underground utility ducts, roads rehabilitation, and
            upgrade, including leveling, and curb reconstruction,
            expected to generate adverse environmental impacts. Soil
            erosion, and water pollution will occur as a result of
            underground excavations, and drainage works, further
            mobilizing contaminants such as lead, and cadmium, in
            addition to construction sediments. Construction of
            trenches, and road widening will potentially damage trees,
            and tree roots, and, the usual air, and noise pollution will
            occur as a result of construction dust, and
            equipment/vibration noise. Mitigating measures include: 1)
            contaminated soils, and toxic wastes, will be tested, and
            disposed of in accordance with the country's
            environmental protection regulations; 2) construction plans
            for drainage systems, surface channels, sediment traps, and
            discharge pits will be submitted to the Project Authority
            for approval; 3) trenches will be constructed manually to
            reduce damaging of tree roots, and attempts will be made to
            minimize damaging the adjacent greenbelt areas. Trees will
            be replanted as needed; 4) water spraying will reduce dust
            and air pollution, materials will be stored in sheltered
            areas, and, debris will be dampened prior to disposal; and,
            5) chemicals, and lubricants will be contained according to regulations.
